alert.note: Alert for Eastern Gifford Pinchot NF - Mt Adams Ranger District; Extreme South Washington Cascades and Foothills (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 04 at 3:52AM PDT until July 05 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...HOT, DRY, UNSTABLE, AND BREEZY CONDITIONS TO IMPACT MUCH OF SOUTHWEST WASHINGTON AND NORTHWEST OREGON THROUGH WEDNESDAY... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT WEDNESDAY FOR DRY AND UNSTABLE CONDITIONS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 660 AND 663... * AFFECTED AREA... In Washington, - Fire Weather Zone 660 Extreme South Washington Cascades and Foothills, and - Fire Weather Zone 663 Eastern Gifford Pinchot National Forest Mt Adams Ranger District. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum RH 15 to 25 percent each afternoon Tuesday and Wednesday. Poor to moderate RH recovery Tuesday night. * HAINES...5 (moderate) to 6 (high). * IMPACTS...Conditions may be favorable for rapid spread on any new or existing fires. Extreme fire behavior is possible, especially from established fires. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of the above conditions can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Check with your local fire agency to see whether burning and/or firework restrictions are in place. Even if burning is legal, do not leave any type of fire unattended.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Gifford Pinchot NF - Mt Adams Ranger District; Extreme South Washington Cascades and Foothills
